com.jaap.antitowerdefence.antiTowerDefence

Class HighScoreDB

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jaap.antitowerdefence.antiTowerDefence.HighScoreDB

  • public class HighScoreDB
extends java.lang.Object
    HighScoreDB.java A class that manages all communication with the Anti Tower Defence highscore database. After the class has been initiated the function connectToDB has to be called to connect to the database.
    Author:
    Anna Osterlund, id10aod

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HighScoreDB()
      Constructor initiates an object of the class

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String addScore(java.lang.String name, int score)
      addScore checks the name for invalid characters and if the name is valid, adds the score to the database.
      boolean connectToDB()
      connectToDB connects to the database using a passwort, a username, a URI and a mySQL JDBC driver.
      java.lang.String[][] getHighScoreTopTen()
      getHighScoreTopTen retrives the ten highest scores from the database, saves the result(name, score) in a String matrix and returns the result
      java.lang.String isHighScore(int score)
      isHighScore checks if a given score is a valid highscore, top ten or higher

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • HighScoreDB

        public HighScoreDB()
        Constructor initiates an object of the class

    • Method Detail

      • connectToDB

        public boolean connectToDB()
        connectToDB connects to the database using a passwort, a username, a URI and a mySQL JDBC driver. If this is successful it sets the prepared statments
        Returns:
        true if the connection was successful, false if not

      • addScore

        public java.lang.String addScore(java.lang.String name,
                                 int score)
        addScore checks the name for invalid characters and if the name is valid, adds the score to the database.
        Parameters:
        name - - player name
        score - - player score
        Returns:
        success if the score was added, invalid if name containd invalid characters, fail if the database insertion failed

      • getHighScoreTopTen

        public java.lang.String[][] getHighScoreTopTen()
        getHighScoreTopTen retrives the ten highest scores from the database, saves the result(name, score) in a String matrix and returns the result
        Returns:
        A String matrix with the result or null

      • isHighScore

        public java.lang.String isHighScore(int score)
        isHighScore checks if a given score is a valid highscore, top ten or higher
        Parameters:
        score - - The score to check
        Returns:
        true if the score qualifies, false is the score does not qualify, fail if the communication with the database fails
